sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW, DUE TO A SINGLE CORRELATED C1/SF FLARE WHICH ERRUPTED FROM REGION 7938 (N12W41) AT 0356Z. sections.text: AT VERY LOW LEVELS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 14/2100Z TO 15/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED BETWEEN MINOR STORM AND QUIET LEVELS. THE TIME FROM 14/2100-15/0300Z WAS THE MOST DISTURBED PERIOD. RECENT SOLAR WIND DATA INDICATE A CORONAL HOLE STREAM IS NOW IN THE EARTH'S VICINITY. WIND DATA FROM 13-14 JAN HAD A CORONAL MASS EJECTION SIGNATURE. THE SOURCE CORONAL HOLE OF THE CURRENT FLOW IS NOT DISCERNIBLE IN X-RAY OR INFRARED IMAGERY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD RANGE FROM QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. ISOLATED MINOR STORMING IS POSSIBLE DURING THAT TIME.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION NUMBER 7952 (S03E37) SHOWED STEADY GROWTH AND PRODUCED FREQUENT B-CLASS SUBFLARES DURING THE LAST 24 HOURS. THE LARGEST OF THESE WAS A B9/SF AT 1620Z. THE GROUP IS CURRENTLY A SMALL BXO TYPE GROUP WITH A NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST MAGNETIC INVER- SION LINE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW TO LOW. THERE IS A FAIR CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED C-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 10/2100Z TO 11/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS PREDOMINATED FROM 10/2100Z THROUGH 11/1500Z WITH A PERIOD OF MAJOR STORM LEVELS FROM 0300-0600Z. CONDITIONS WERE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FROM 11/1500Z TO THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED WITH SOME ISOLATED ACTIVE PERIODS OVER THE NEXT 12-24 HOURS DUE TO PERSISTENCE. CONDITIONS SHOULD BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED THEREAFTER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 11/2100Z
sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. REGION 7952 (S03E22) PRODUCED ONLY ONE FLARE TODAY: A B2/SF AT 1925Z. THE REGION GREW IN WHITE LIGHT TO A 17 SPOT DAO GROUP WITH AN ELONGATED CONFIGURATION. ACTIVITY IN THE REGION HAS BEEN REDUCED COMPARED TO YESTERDAY AS ITS MAGNETIC FIELD STRUCTURES HAVE BECOME LESS SHEARED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW TO LOW. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A POSSIBILITY FOR AN ISOLATED C-CLASS FLARE FROM REGION 7952.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 11/2100Z TO 12/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS. UNSETTLED CONDITIONS PREVAILED MOST OF THE DAY BUT OCCASIONAL BRIEF ACTIVE PERIODS OCCURRED AT MID- LATITUDES FROM 0300-0600Z AND AT HIGH LATITUDES FROM 1200- 1800Z. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUX OBSERVED AT GOES-8 EXCEEDED 1000 PFU TODAY AT 1500Z AND CONTINUED TO BE ABOVE THRESHOLD AT FORECAST ISSUE TIME.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS. AN INCREASE TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS IS EXPECTED LATE ON DAY TWO AND CONTINUING THROUGH DAY THREE IN RESPONSE TO EFFECTS FROM A CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. REGION 7952 (S04W04) IS THE ONLY SPOTTED REGION ON THE DISK AND HAS CONTINUED TO DECAY OVER THE LAST 24 HOURS. THE NORTHERN POLAR CROWN FILAMENT DISAPPEARED SOMETIME BETWEEN 13/2119Z AND 14/1443Z. THE YOHKOH SXT IMAGE OF 14/1212Z SHOWS ENHANCED X-RAY EMISSION ALONG THE POSITION OF THE FILAMENT, WHICH SUGGESTS THAT THE FILAMENT ERUPTED. THE FILAMENT WAS ABOUT 22 DEGREES LONG AND WAS LOCATED ALONG AN EAST-WEST DIRECTION FROM N44W15 TO N44W36.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 13/2100Z TO 14/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUXES MEASURED AT GOES-8 HAVE BEEN ABOVE 1000 PFU FOR MUCH OF THE DAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED WITH SOME BRIEF ACTIVE PERIODS FOR THE NEXT 24-36 HOURS. THE ENHANCED ACTIVITY LEVELS ARE POSSIBLE DUE TO EFFECTS FROM A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE. ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE PREDICTED ON THE THIRD DAY AS A LIKELY RESPONSE TO TODAY'S FILAMENT ERUPTION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 20/2100Z TO 21/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS, WITH A SINGLE MINOR STORM INTERVAL RECORDED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES DURING THE PERIOD 21/0000-0300Z, AND A SINGLE MAJOR STORM INTERVAL RECORDED AT HIGH LATITUDES DURING THE PERIOD 21/1500-1800Z. THE GT 2 MEV ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUX RANGED FROM MODERATE TO HIGH, HAVING JUST DROPPED BACK DOWN TO MODERATE LEVELS AT THE END OF THE REPORTING PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO REMAIN AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS, THEN DROPPING TO QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR DAYS TWO AND THREE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW.  REGION 7953 (N08E10) HAS GROWN CONSIDERABLY SINCE YESTERDAY AND IS CURRENTLY A COMPLEX 13 SPOT 'DSI' BETA-GAMMA GROUP. SEVEN B-CLASS X-RAY EVENTS WERE REGISTERED DURING THE REPORTING PERIOD, THE MOST SIGNIFICANT BEING A B4 EVENT AT 22/1914Z, WHICH WAS OPTICALLY CORRELATED AS A SUB-FLARE WITH AN AREA OF 12 MILS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW, ALTHOUGH REGION 7953 HAS AN INCREASED 30 PERCENT CHANCE OF GENERATING A C-CLASS EVENT, AND 5 PERCENT CHANCE OF GENERATING AN M-CLASS EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 21/2100Z TO 22/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS AT ALL LATITUDES.  ENERGETIC ELECTRONS HAVE RANGED FROM MODERATE TO THEIR CURRENT HIGH LEVELS.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO ACTIVE, WITH THE CHANCE FOR ISOLATED PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS.  CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO DROP TO QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR DAYS TWO AND THREE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY BECAME LOW BY VIRTUE OF A C1/SF FLARE FROM REGION 7953 (N07W01). THIS REGION CONTINUED TO GROW AT A SLOW PACE AND WEAK MIXED POLARITIES REMAINED. PRIOR TO THE C1 FLARE, REGION 7953 EXHIBITED A SLOW DECLINE IN PLAGE BRIGHTNESS AND BACKGROUND X-RAY AND RADIO EMISSIONS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BE
sections.text: PREDOMINANTLY VERY LOW. REGION 7953 IS CAPABLE OF ANOTHER SMALL C-CLASS EVENT BUT THE GENERAL TREND SHOULD BE ONE OF SLOW DECAY AND LESSENED BURST ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED. RECENT SOLAR WIND DATA INDICATE A MODERATELY FAST AND LOW DENSITY STREAM IN THE VICINITY OF THE EARTH. THIS HOLE-LIKE STREAM HAS NO OBVIOUS SOLAR SOURCE IN X-RAYS OR EUV. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES AT GEOSYNCHRONOUS ORBIT WERE MODERATE TO HIGH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: FORECAST TO BE PREDOMINANTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. ISOLATED ACTIVE CONDITIONS, MAINLY AT HIGH LATITUDES, ARE POSSIBLE ON 24 MAR. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES SHOULD REMAIN ENHANCED FOR SEVERAL MORE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 23/2100Z
sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY RETURNED TO A VERY LOW LEVEL. REGION 7953 (N07W16) STABILIZED AND PRODUCED ONLY MINOR INTENSITY FLUCTUATIONS. MINOR MIXED POLARITIES REMAINED IN THIS REGION.

sections.text: A VERY LOW LEVEL. THERE IS ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A C-CLASS FLARE FROM REGION 7953.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 23/2100Z TO 24/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS PREDOMINANTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED. ACTIVE CONDITIONS WERE OBSERVED AT SEVERAL SITES BETWEEN 24/0000-0300Z. SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES EXPERIENCED MINOR TO MAJOR STORMING BETWEEN 24/1200-1800Z. SOLAR WIND VELOCITIES ON 24 MAR INCREASED ABOUT 100 KM/S OVER 23 MAR VALUES TO NEAR 580 KM/S. THIS MAXIMUM VELOCITY OCCURRED NEAR 24/1942Z WHEN BZ WAS ALSO OBSERVED TO ABRUPTLY TURN SOUTHWARD TO MODERATE LEVELS. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES AT GEOSYNCHRONOUS ORBIT WERE MOSTLY MODERATE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: FORECAST TO BE PREDOMINANTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR 25 MAR. ACTIVE PERIODS ARE LIKELY EARLY ON 25 MAR. SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES COULD EXPERIENCE MINOR TO MAJOR STORMING THAT DAY IN RESPONSE TO THE HIGH SPEED STREAM IN THE EARTH'S VICINITY. THIS DISTURBANCE SHOULD LESSEN ON 26 MAR AND MOSTLY QUIET LEVELS ARE PREDICTED FOR 27 MAR.

sections.text: VERY LOW FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 24/2100Z TO 25/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED. ACTIVE CONDITIONS WERE OBSERVED EARLY IN THE PERIOD. SOME ISOLATED HIGH LATITUDE SITES EXPERIENCED MINOR TO SEVERE STORMING BETWEEN 25/1200-1800Z. SOLAR WIND DATA CONTINUE TO INDICATE A CORONAL HOLE STREAM NEAR EARTH. THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE OF THIS STREAM IS THE SOUTHERN POLAR HOLE. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES AT GEOSYNCHRONOUS ORBIT WERE MODERATE TO HIGH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD RANGE FROM QUIET TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE ON 26 MAR. MINOR TO MAJOR STORMING REMAINS A POSSIBILITY FOR HIGH LATITUDE SITES. SOLAR WIND DATA FROM LAST SOLAR ROTATION INDICATE A LESSENING OF STREAM VELOCITY ON 27 MAR. THE FIELD SHOULD BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED THAT DAY AND MOSTLY QUIET ON 28 MAR AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE FINALLY SUBSIDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 04/2100Z
sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. GOES SPACECRAFT DETECTED A C3 X-RAY BURST AT 05/1838Z WITH AN ASSOCIATED TYPE II SWEEP. THERE WAS NO OPTICAL ACTIVITY CORRELATED WITH THE BURST. AN EARLIER B9 X-RAY BURST WAS DETECTED AT 05/1029Z AND CAN BE CORRELATED WITH ACTIVE SURGING IN A PLAGE REGION NEAR S10E77. THIS REGION HAS NOT EXHIBITED SPOTS YET, SO REMAINS UNNUMBERED. THE REGION APPEARS TO BE THE RETURN OF SWO REGION 7957.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW TO LOW OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST PERIOD. THE UNNUMBERED REGION NEAR S10E77 IS UNDER SCRUTINY. IT HAS A CHANCE OF DEVELOPING INTO A SPOTTED REGION AND PRODUCING FURTHER C-CLASS X-RAY ACTIVITY. IT WILL BE NUMBERED WHEN ACTIVITY CAN BE POSITIVELY CORRELATED WITH IT.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT 48 HOURS. THE FILED IS EXPECTED TO BECOME MOSTLY UNSETTLED THEREAFTER IN RESPONSE TO THE ANTICIPATED CORONAL MASS EJECTION SHOCK WAVE INDICATED BY THE PREVIOUSLY MENTIONED ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 09/2100Z
sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. REGION 7962 (S06E28) IS THE LARGEST SUNSPOT GROUP ON DISK, BUT COULD PRODUCE ONLY INFREQUENT B-CLASS LEVEL ACTIVITY. TWO MEDIUM SIZED SPOTS WITH PENUMBRA CONSTITUTE MOST OF THE 120 MILLIONTHS AREA OF THE GROUP. BOTH THESE SPOTS ARE MOSTLY POSITIVE POLARITY, BUT THE 'TRAILER' HAS A WEAK DELTA CONFIGURATION DUE TO A SMALL SECTION OF NEGATIVE POLARITY PENUMBRA IN THE SOUTHERN PART OF THE SPOT. MOST OF THE GROWTH AND ACTIVITY IN THIS GROUP, HOWEVER, IS OCCURRING TO THE EAST OF THE BIG SPOTS, IN A SECTION OF WEAKER BUT MORE SHEARED MAGNETIC FIELDS. A HIGH-LATITUDE, REVERSE POLARITY SPOT GROUP (NUMBERED 7963) EMERGED TODAY NEAR N25E42 AS A SIMPLE B-TYPE REGION. THE LOCATION AND MAGNETIC CHARACTER IF THE GROUP STRONGLY SUGGEST THAT IT IS A NEW CYCLE SUNSPOT REGION.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW TO LOW. THERE IS A FAIR CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED C-CLASS FLARE FROM REGION 7962.

sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW.  REGION 7968 (N02W15), THE ONLY ACTIVE REGION CURRENTLY ON THE VISIBLE DISK, HAS GROWN SIGNIFICANTLY IN BOTH SIZE AND NUMBER OF SPOTS SINCE YESTERDAY. THIS REGION HAS PRODUCED THREE B-CLASS FLARES IN THE LAST 24 HOURS, ONE AT 0956Z OPTICALLY CORRELATED AS A SUB- FLARE.  THE LARGE TWELVE DEGREE FILAMENT LOCATED AT N06E24 INCREASED IN WIDTH, LENGTH, AND DENSITY SINCE YESTERDAY, BUT REMAINS RELATIVELY MOTIONLESS.

sections.text: VERY LOW, WITH A 60% CHANCE FOR A C-CLASS EVENT AND 10% CHANCE OF AN M-CLASS EVENT GENERATED FROM REGION 7968 DURING THE NEXT 24 HOURS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7978 (S10W24) PRO- DUCED SEVERAL C-CLASS EVENTS TODAY. THE LARGEST OF THESE WAS A C1/SF AT 0900Z. THE GROUP EXHIBITED SIGNIFICANT EMERGENCE OF MAGNETIC FLUX OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS. THIS FLUX EMERGENCE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A REMARKABLE INCREASE IN SPOT AREA FROM 30 TO 210 MILLIONTHS OF A SOLAR HEMISPHERE. THE EMERGENCE OF NEGATIVE POLARITY SPOTS THAT HAVE COMBINED WITH A CENTRAL, POSITIVE POLARITY PORTION OF THE REGION HAVE LED TO THE FORM- ATION OF A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION.

sections.text: LOW. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THE OCCURRENCE OF AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT FROM REGION 7978.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A PERIOD OF ACTIVE LEVELS OCCURRED AT HIGH LATITUDES FROM 0600-0900Z.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY BECAME HIGH DUE TO AN X2.6/1B AT 09/0911Z FROM REGION 7978 (S10W37). THIS FLARE ROSE IMPULSIVELY AND FELL QUICKLY OFF MAXIMUM BUT THE OVERALL DECAY WAS ABOUT TWO HOURS LONG. A 10 CM BURST OF 1100 F.U. WAS OBSERVED BUT NO TYPE II OR IV SWEPT FREQUENCY BURSTS WERE SEEN. THERE ARE INDICATIONS THAT A CME WAS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS EVENT. REGION 7978 ALSO PRODUCED AN M1/SF AT 09/0144Z. THE RAPID EMERGENCE OF REGION 7978 REPORTED ON 08 JUL BEGAN TO ABATE DURING THE PERIOD. HOWEVER, TIGHT MAGNETIC GRADIENTS AND A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION REMAINED. (NOTE: THIS IS THE FIRST X-CLASS FLARE SINCE NOV 1992.)

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS FORECAST TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 7978 APPEARS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING M-CLASS EVENTS AS IT CONTINUES TO EMERGE AT ITS SLACKENED PACE. A REPEAT OF AN X-CLASS FLARE FROM THIS REGION IS A POSSIBILITY BUT NOT A LIKELIHOOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 08/2100Z TO 09/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO SLIGHTLY UNSETTLED. AT ISSUE TIME, NO ENERGETIC PROTONS HAD BEEN OBSERVED FROM THE X2 FLARE MENTIONED ABOVE. AFTER THIS LONG OF A DELAY, IT IS UNLIKELY SIGNIFICANT FLUXES WILL APPEAR.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD REMAIN QUIET TO SLIGHTLY UNSETTLED THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING HOURS OF 11 JUL. FOLLOWING THAT TIME, AND CONTINUING THROUGH 12 JUL, ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS ARE FORECAST DUE TO THE FLARE AND POSSIBLE CME MENTIONED ABOVE. ISOLATED MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE LATE ON 11 JUL AND EARLY ON 12 JUL.

sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7978 (S11W50) PRODUCED AN M1/SF FLARE AT 10/0343Z. THIS REGION ALSO PRODUCED NUMEROUS SMALL TO MID LEVEL C-CLASS FLARES. SLIGHT DECAY WAS OBSERVED IN THIS REGION AND THE DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION BECAME LESS OBVIOUS. AREAS OF MIXED POLARITIES AND TIGHT GRADIENTS REMAINED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS FORECAST TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO OCCASIONALLY MODERATE. THE FREQUENCY OF BOTH C AND M-CLASS FLARES SHOULD DECREASE AS THE REGION CONTINUES TO SLOWLY DECAY. THE POSSIBILITY OF AN ISOLATED X-CLASS FLARE FROM THIS REGION REMAINS, BUT IS LOW.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS QUIET.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE QUIET TO SLIGHTLY UNSETTLED UNTIL NEAR MIDDAY ON 11 JUL WHEN ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS ARE FORECAST TO BEGIN. THIS FORECAST IS BASED UPON THE X2 FLARE AND SUSPECTED CORONAL MASS EJECTION AT 09/0911Z. PERIODS OF MAJOR STORMING ARE POSSIBLE AT HIGH LATITUDES LATE ON 11 JUL AND ON 12 JUL. UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE FORECAST FOR 13 JUL AS THE DISTURBANCE SUBSIDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS AT LOW LEVELS. REGION 7978 (S11W64) PRODUCED SEVERAL LOW LEVEL C-CLASS FLARES. DECAY CONTINUED IN THIS REGION AND THE DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION FADED DUE TO LOSS OF PENUMBRAE IN THE CENTER OF THE REGION. SOME MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY REMAINS BUT TO A MUCH LESSER DEGREE THAN SEVERAL DAYS AGO.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS FORECAST TO BE
sections.text: PREDOMINANTLY LOW. REGION 7978 RETAINS THE CAPABILITY OF PRODUCING AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE BUT THIS IS BECOMING LESS LIKELY AS DECAY CONTINUES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 10/2100Z TO 11/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET. THE DISTURBANCE FROM THE X2 FLARE AND SUSPECTED CME ON 09 JUL DID NOT ARRIVE AT THE TIME EXPECTED. HOWEVER, FURTHER INFORMATION ON THE CME INDICATES THAT IT WAS QUITE BROAD IN LONGITUDINAL EXTENT AND TRAVELLING AT A VELOCITY OF APPROXIMATELY 400 KM/S.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: FORECAST TO BECOME UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE ON 12 JUL. A 400 KM/S VELOCITY OF THE CME EQUATES TO AN ARRIVAL TIME OF NEAR 1200Z ON 12 JUL. PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING LATE ON 12 JUL AND EARLY ON 13 JUL ARE LIKELY WITH ISOLATED MAJOR STORMING POSSIBLE. THIS DISTURBANCE SHOULD SUBSIDE ON 14 JUL AND UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE FORECAST FOR THAT DAY.

HIGH LATITUDES ACTIVE                10/10/10 MINOR STORM           05/05/05 MAJOR-SEVERE STORM    01/01/01   From owner-forecast@proton.sel.noaa.gov Thu Aug 22 18:40:24 1996 Received: by proton.sel.noaa.gov (1.37.109.18/16.2) id AA280563624; Thu, 22 Aug 1996 18:40:24 -0400 Return-Path: <owner-forecast@proton.sel.noaa.gov> Date: Thu, 22 Aug 1996 22:40:23 GMT From: SESC <sel@proton.sel.noaa.gov> To: forecast-send@proton.sel.noaa.gov Subject: SEC problems Sender: owner-forecast@proton.sel.noaa.gov Precedence: bulk  Dear SEC Customer,  SEC experienced a major problem with its main data base late on August 16. The data base was not restarted until August 19. During that time, the Outside User Systems (OUS) products could not update. Products issued since the data base recovered are being updated.  The products missed between August 16-19 are still not available but should be restored over the next several days. These products will not be automatically emailed to majordomo customers. If you cannot access the missed products through the OUS Gopher or FTP please let us know and we will email them to you.  We are sorry for the inconvenience this caused many of our customers.  If we can be of further assistance please call.  Sincerely,   Viola Raben vraben@sec.noaa.gov  Larry E. Combs (303) 497-5299 lcombs@sec.noaa.gov

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES, AND UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS. THIS INCREASED ACTIVITY IS BELIEVED TOL HOLE. SOLAR WIND DATA RECEIVE D TODAY FROM THE WIND SPACECRAFT REVEALED VELOCITIES IN EXCESS OF 600 KM/S AND DENSITIES IN THE 4-6 P/CC RANGE. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRONS CONTINUE TO FLUCTUATE IN THE MODERATE TO HIGH RANGE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO REMAIN UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS, WITH A HIGH PROBABILITY FOR ISOLATED PERIODS OF MINOR AND MAJOR STORMING, AND THEN REVERTING BACK TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED CONDITIONS ON DAYS TWO AND THREE.

sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  THE SOLAR DISK REMAINED SPOTLESS AND SOLAR ACTIVITY REMAINED VERY LOW. THE MAUNA LOA OBSERVATORY REPORTED A CORONAL MASS EJECTION NEAR SE30 ON 16 OCT BETWEEN 1711-1929Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 16/2100Z TO 17/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS PREDOMINANTLY QUIET. THE RECURRENT CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE FORECAST TO BEGIN ON 17 OCT HAS FAILED TO MATERIALIZE. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES AT GEOSYNCHRONOUS ORBIT WERE MODERATE TO HIGH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: FORECAST TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED. THERE IS A POSSIBILITY THAT THE RECURRENT STREAM WILL ARRIVE LATE BUT THIS POSSIBILITY DIMINISHES AS TIME PASSES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO MINOR STORM. SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES EXPERIENCED PERIODS OF MAJOR STORMING. EARLY IN THE PERIOD, SOLAR WIND VELOCITIES INCREASED AND DENSITIES DECREASED INDICATING THE BELATED ARRIVAL OF THE CORONAL HOLE DISTURBANCE EXPECTED ON 17 OCT. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES WERE MODERATE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE AT QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THROUGH 20 OCT. QUIET TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE FORECAST FOR 21 OCT AS THE CURRENT CORONAL HOLE DISTURBANCE SUBSIDES. ENERGETIC ELECTION FLUXES SHOULD RETURN TO HIGH LEVELS ON 19 OCT.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 18/2100Z
sections.text: TO 19/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY REMAINED VERY LOW. HOWEVER, A LARGE FILAMENT LOCATED BETWEEN S28E61-S33E80 BEGAN TO DISAPPEAR NEAR 19/1600Z. THIS FILAMENT BECAME AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE AS IT CONTINUED OUT BEYOND THE LIMB NEAR S28 TO A MAXIMUM HEIGHT OF 0.4R BEFORE FADING IN H-ALPHA. A LONG DURATION SOFT X-RAY ENHANCEMENT BEGAN NEAR 19/1625Z AND REACHED A MAXIMUM OF A6 AT 19/1738Z. THE DECAY OF THIS X-RAY EVENT CONTINUES AT ISSUE TIME. IT IS CERTAIN THIS EVENT REPRESENTS A LARGE CORONAL MASS EJECTION. A NEW SMALL REGION IS APPEARING AT APPROXIMATELY N15E90 IN RECENT YOHKOH IMAGES.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR FLARE ACTIVITY SHOULD
sections.text: CONTINUE AT A VERY LOW LEVEL FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 18/2100Z TO 19/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED BETWEEN UNSETTLED AND MINOR STORM LEVELS DURING THE PERIOD AS THE CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE CONTINUED. SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES EXPERIENCED PERIODS OF MAJOR STORMING. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES AT GEOSYNCHRONOUS ORBIT WERE MODERATE TO HIGH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD REMAIN AT UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR 20 OCT AND EARLY 21 OCT. UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS SHOULD BE EXPERIENCED FOR THE LATTER HALF OF 21 OCT AND THROUGH 22 OCT. THE PROBABLE CME MENTIONED ABOVE IS NOT EXPECTED TO IMPACT THE EARTH DUE TO ITS MODERATELY HIGH LATITUDE, NEAR EAST LIMB LOCATION, AND APPARENT TRAJECTORY OUT OF THE ECLIPTIC PLANE.

sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY REMAINED VERY LOW. SMALL NEW REGION 7990 EMERGED AT N15E27. THE EMERGENCE OF THIS REGION ENDS A 36 DAY PERIOD OF A SPOTLESS SUN. THE LAST SPOTLESS PERIOD OF THIS LENGTH WAS OBSERVED IN 1944.

sections.text: AT VERY LOW LEVELS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 19/2100Z TO 20/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE PERIOD AND PREDOMINANTLY QUIET FOR THE LATTER HALF. RECENT SOLAR WIND DATA SHOW DECREASING VELOCITY HERALDING THE DEMISE OF THE CURRENT CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES AT GEOSYNCHRONOUS ORBIT WERE PREDOMIANTLY HIGH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE QUIET TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE FOR THE FIRST HALF OF 21 OCT. QUIET TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS SHOULD FOLLOW AND CONTINUE UNTIL 23 OCT WHEN ANOTHER CORONAL HOLE DISTURBANCE IS FORECAST TO BEGIN. UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS ARE FORCAST FOR THAT DATE.

sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7999 (S04E19) CONTINUED TO PRODUCE SMALL C-CLASS FLARES, BUT AT A HIGHER CADENCE THAN YESTERDAY. THE REGION DOUBLED IN SPOT AREA TO 33O MILLIONTHS, AND SHOWS FREQUENT PLAGE FLUCTUATIONS. THE OTHER SPOTTED REGION, 7997 (N05W54), WAS QUIET AND STABLE. SOHO FE XII IMAGERY INDICATE A POSSIBLE CME FROM A SITE JUST SOUTH OF REGION 7997 AT APPROXIMATELY 1200Z. THE ARCADE SPANNED THE EQUATOR, CONNECTING TO NEAR S15. THE 10.7 CM FLUX REACHED THE HIGHEST DAILY VALUE SINCE MARCH 3, 1994.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. A VERY LONG DURATION B9 X-RAY EVENT OCCURRED BETWEEN 26/2048-27/0456Z. OPTICAL OBSERVATORIES OBSERVED BRIGHT KNOTS OF MATERIAL FLOWING ABOVE THE WEST LIMB NEAR N05 WHERE REGION 7997 IS LOCATED. SPACE-BASED CORONAGRAPH IMAGES NEAR THE PEAK OF THE EVENT SHOWED A LARGE (GREATER THAN 1 SOLAR DIAMETER) CORONAL MASS EJECTION OVER THE WEST LIMB. YOHKOH X-RAY IMAGES IN THE DECAY OF THE EVENT SHOWED A LARGE, POST-CME ARCADE IN THAT LOCATION. REGION 7999 (S05W21) WAS STABLE AND WEAK MIXED POLARITIES REMAINED IN THE CENTER OF THE REGION.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS FORECAST TO
sections.text: BE LOW. REGION 7999 RETAINS THE CAPABILITY OF PRODUCING C-CLASS AND ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENTS.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED. ISOLATED ACTIVE CONDITIONS WERE EXPERIENCED IN THE 27/0300-0600Z PERIOD. SOLAR WIND DATA SHOW A MODERATELY HIGH VELOCITY (500-575 KM/S) STREAM IN THE EARTH'S VICINITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: FORECAST TO BE QUIET TO SLIGHTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THE CORONAL MASS EJECTION MENTIONED ABOVE IS NOT EXPECTED TO IMPACT THE EARTH.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS FORECAST TO
sections.text: BE PREDOMINANTLY LOW WITH AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE POSSIBLE FROM REGION 7999. IT IS NOT LIKELY THE M-CLASS FLARE MENTIONED ABOVE IS THE BEGINNING OF AN INCREASE IN FLARE ACTIVITY FROM REGION 7999 BECAUSE OF GENERAL DECAY IN THE REGION. THE M1 FLARE IS MORE LIKELY A RESULT OF SUNSPOT PROPER MOTION AND REALIGNMENT OF THE OVERLYING FIELDS. THE PROPER MOTION OCCURRED AT THE SOUTHERNMOST PART OF THE REGION SO THIS PHENOMENON IS NOT EXPECTED TO CONTINUE.

HIGH LATITUDES ACTIVE                01/01/01 MINOR STORM           01/01/01 MAJOR-SEVERE STORM    01/01/01    From owner-forecast@proton.sel.noaa.gov Mon Dec  9 19:08:46 1996 Received: by proton.sel.noaa.gov (1.37.109.18/16.2) id AA275116525; Mon, 9 Dec 1996 19:08:46 -0500 Return-Path: <owner-forecast@proton.sel.noaa.gov> Date: Tue, 10 Dec 1996 00:08:44 GMT From: SESC <sel@proton.sel.noaa.gov> To: forecast-send@proton.sel.noaa.gov Subject: SEC Announcement Sender: owner-forecast@proton.sel.noaa.gov Precedence: bulk   -----  SEC Product HEADER Change Announcement -----   Dear Space Environment Center (SEC) customer:  SEC is converting its products and data listings to a more consistant header format. Samples of the old and new formats are shown below.  In general, the changes add header and information lines with a unique beginning character: o  A "#" in the first column indicates a header line o  A ":" n the first column indicates a key-word line. The key-word between the colons is followed by some information All products and listings will have two addtional lines: its name and issue date.  THERE ARE NO FORMAT CHANGES WITHIN THE PRODUCTS only to the header lines.   !!!!!!!  The new formats will begin sometime after Dec 11th.  !!!!!!!  Products initially effected: Alert and Warning Messages RSGA - the "Forecast" - Report of Solar and Geophysical Activity SRS  - Solar Region Summary SGAS - Solar and Geophysical Activity Summary SCDR - Solar Coronal Disturbance Report GEOA - GEOALERT WWV  - The Geophysical Alert Message Weekly Highlights and Forecast Weekly 27-day Outlook  SEC Services effected: Majodomo List Server World-wide web (only products in/from the Gopher/ftp directories) Gopher ftp  Update on other SEC changes: The new software to move us off the old database machine is scheduled to be installed beginning December 16th. While these changes will not effect the product format or contain, they may cause disturbtions in service. Please bear with us during this transition.  We apologize for the inconvience these changes will cause our customers, espically those who have developed software to decode our products. Again, these are changes to the header line only, the product format do NOT change. Our objectives are to: o standardize our products, o provide additional information with each product, o improve the reliabilities of our services, o establish format conventions for upcoming, new products.  Please send questions and comments to Viola Raben at vraben@sec.noaa.gov or (303) 497-5691.   Sincerely,  Viola Raben Space Environment Center   ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ SAMPLE OLD FORMAT  Prepared jointly by the U.S. Dept. of Commerce, NOAA, Space Environment Center and the U.S. Air Force.   ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ SAMPLE NEW FORMAT :Product: RSGA :Issued: 1996 Dec 9 2210UT # Prepared jointly by the U.S. Dept. of Commerce, NOAA, # Space Environment Center and the U.S. Air Force. #

GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 10/2100Z TO 11/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC  FIELD WAS QUIET TO ACTIVE. ACTIVITY WAS MOST LIKELY THE RESULT OF A WELL PLACED CORONAL HOLE THAT IS MOVING AWAY FROM ITS GEOEFFECTIVE POSITION. PRELIMINARY SOLAR WIND DATA INDICATE WE ARE NOW MOVING OUT OF THE LOW-DENSITY, HIGH-SPEED CORONAL HOLE STREAM.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST PERIOD. ACTIVE LEVELS ARE STILL POSSIBLE AT HIGH LATITUDES FOR THE NEXT 12-24 HOURS.
